This narrow path could be bypassed if the gate to the compound on the Salford side was left open so people could easily walk or cycle through this much wider existing path.

253.title: Poor road layout
253.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Speeding_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
253.solutions: More space to walk_,_Slow down traffic_,_More space to cycle_,_Less parking_,_Better crossings
253.comment: This junction is a dangerous crossing where cars speed through. Trying to get across the roundabout and onto Wallingford road is extremely risky as there is very little space.

254.title: Local cycling route
254.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Behaviour of road users users
254.solutions: Add temporary cycle path_,_More space to cycle_,_Less parking
254.comment: This is a direct route to Trafford General and on to Woodsend. On street parking makes this a narrow road, keeping wide of car door opening results in close passing by drivers.  Enable cycling by removing onstreet parking and add a cycle lane

255.title: NA
255.issues: Speeding_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Hedges need trimming back
255.solutions: Slow down traffic_,_More space to walk_,_Extend pavement_,_Hedges need trimming back
255.comment: Private garden hedges need trimming back to footway boundary line, so can use northern footway. Some vehicles travel too fast through here, so risky to walk in carriageway. Temporary cones to widen footway may also help to slow traffic.

256.title: On street parking
256.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users
256.solutions: Slow down traffic_,_Less parking_,_More space to cycle_,_Add temporary cycle path
256.comment: The majority of the houses in this road have driveways bit prefer to park on the road, restricting visibility and access for other road users. Could parking restrictions be used to encourage people to park on their drives?

257.title: My commute from work
257.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Parking by local minibus company at the pedestrian/traffic lights
257.comment: There are always large minibuses/small coaches parked here obscuring the traffic lights.  This reduces visibility of pedestrians.  Prevent parking here and enforce it

258.title: Obstructed bike lane
258.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
258.solutions: More space to cycle_,_Add temporary cycle path
258.comment: The existing bike lane is inadequate, poorly maintained and blocked by vegetation in places

259.title: My local high street
259.solutions: Unlock the gates at this passageway
259.comment: This passageway is a direct route to/from ~Flixton Road and Bowfell but it is locked at certain times.  Unlock the gates to allow pedestrian access at all times

260.title: Dangerous crossing
260.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Behaviour of road users users
260.comment: Crossing Kings Rd and Lime Road when walking on Edge Lane is dangerous with no pedestrian priority and traffic from multiple directions

261.title: Narrow alleyway linking two roads
261.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
261.comment: This short alleyway is sometimes used as a cut through for people on mopeds and scooters. Sometyoe of gate or barrier which would allow cyclists, buggies, wheelchairs and pedestrians but would stop motorized vehicles would be welcome

262.title: Cycle lane improvement
262.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users
262.comment:
Cycle lane segregation should be extended to Great Stone Road junction. Number of cars accelerating to "left hook" cyclists is unacceptable.
Narrowing of cycle lane after orca wands stop is poor and could be prevented by removing the right turn only lane.
Delivery vehicles parking, in cycle lane, outside Lancastrian Office Suites is unacceptable. All deliveries should be made via an entrance in the case park.

263.title: Crossing
263.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Holding pen_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
263.solutions: Better crossings_,_Extend pavement_,_More space to cycle
263.comment:
This crossing has Bee Network funding available. It is vital this work is brought forward.
The only crossing, with signals, forces pedestrians into a holding pen that does not allow for social distancing. Crossing the other three points is hindered by vehicles jumping amber/red lights.

264.title: Glebelands Road
264.issues: Speeding_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Behaviour of road users users
264.comment: There are speed 'bumps' on the top end of Glebelands Rd. There is none on the lower end towards Ashton on Mersey village, drivers tend to use this stretch of road to speed. This is very frequent occurrence and has become more dangerous in the last 8 weeks as pedestrian and cycle traffic has increased as people use this road to get onto the Mersey Valley area near Church Lane and Little Ees Lane. It would be good to consider speed measures along the whole of the road in order to deter drivers who use this stretch of road as a speed track.

265.title: Crossing and turning
265.issues: Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Crossing difficulty, speed of cars turning
265.comment: Crossing old hall road around broad road and wythenshaw road is terrible. Cars turn at speed both directions into broad road and wythenshaw road both with wide turnings encouraging speed and close passing cyclists. Pedestrian crossing of old hall road can be very difficult when busy with no crossing or even central refuges

266.title: Poor road layout
266.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Speeding_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Volumes of traffic
266.solutions: More space to cycle_,_Extend pavement_,_More space to walk_,_Slow down traffic
266.comment: This section of road is used by traffic in a hurry to get to/from Warburton bridge. Cars speed along here and close pass cyclists

267.title: Local walking route
267.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Pavement ends
267.comment: There is a pavement on the south bound side of Chassen Road which ends at the entrance to the park. It then becomes a desire line with what appears to be gravel put down. This is on the direct route to the railway station and to the shops on Church Road and Flixton girls high school.  The pavement on the opposite side is narrow so additional pavement here would enable physical distancing and safety.

268.title: Local walking route
268.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Overgrown privets force pedestrians into the road.
268.comment: The privets from the Roebuck pub prevent the pavement being used for people in wheelchairs or pushing prams/buggies.  The privets need to be cut right back.  Additionally the pavement could be built out to reduce the angle of the junction to slow down vehicles as they join Chassen Road - this would make it easier to cross Church Road

269.title: Parking
269.comment:
The missing orca wands should be replaced.
A cycle lane becomes useless if it merely provides extra parking space for vehicles.
The cycle lane should be mandatory for its whole length, with proper enforcement.
The houses have drives and this is a vital route into/out of Manchester City centre. Those using active travel should not be hindered by people using public realm, cycle lanes, as a storage area for their vehicles.

270.title: Northenden road
270.solutions: Slow down traffic_,_Add temporary cycle path
270.comment: Main route between sale and sale moor can see big speeds from cars on wide single lane road. Lots of wide turnings for cars taken at speed and long for pedestrians to cross. No cycle lane and terrible surfaces. Pinch points for cycles around crossing refuges.

271.title: My commute to work
271.comment: Using Melville Road for cyling cuts out dangerous right turns and Sevenways roundabout. Add a filter here for cyclists to and from Park Road and it provides continuous access between Stretford and Urmston

272.title: Brooks Drive public right of way has been blocked off by very high (looks professionally installed) fencing. Blocks what would otherwise be an ideal quiet route linking Hale Barns.

273.title: School crossing / lollipop crossing place
273.comment: It would be good to have a zebra crossing where the school crossing patrol is, and no parking spaces immediately adjacent, to allow safer crossing. Children's after school activities mean they have to cross with no safe crossing place once the school patrol has finished.

274.title: Cars parked on both sides of the road
274.issues: Speeding_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Behaviour of road users users
274.comment: The majority of the houses on this road but there are cars parked on both sides of the road restricting visibility and access. This road is a cut through to joining the A56 and cars speed down here. Enforced parking restrictions may encourage people to park on their driveways and create space on the road

275.title: On street parking
275.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Behaviour of road users users
275.solutions: Add temporary cycle path_,_More space to walk_,_Prevent through traffic_,_Spaces to sit and wait_,_More space to cycle_,_Extend pavement
275.comment: Restricted road width due to parked cars. Poor quality surface too. Dark due to tree cover, therefore difficult to see and be seen. Very narrow pavement means impossible to stay 2m apart from other pedestrians.

276.title: Crossings
276.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Holding pens
276.comment:
Much better crossings needed.
Removing guardrails that create inappropriate holding pens would be a welcome first step.

277.title: Cars driving on cycle lane
277.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Behaviour of road users users
277.comment: On the southbound section of Stretford Rd at this location, there are always vehicles parked on the footways which cause a direct safety issues for pedestrians. Besides, cars tend to driver over the cycle lane on street, making it not safe for cyclists neither. Some bolards as per other sections of Talbot Rd and Stretford Rd would be ideal here.

278.title: Cars regularly speed on Delahays Road

279.title: Need for safe active travel infrastructure
279.issues: Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic
279.comment: This should apply from junction with Church Road to Chester Road

280.title: Need for safe active travel infrastructure
280.issues: Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic
280.comment: This should apply from junction with Church Road to Chester Road

281.title: Need for safe active travel infrastructure
281.issues: Speeding_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Behaviour of road users users
281.comment: This should apply from junction with Church Road to Chester Road

282.title: Need for safe active travel infrastructure
282.issues: Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic
282.comment: This should apply from junction with Flixton Road to Stretford Road

283.title: Need for safe active travel infrastructure
283.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users
283.comment: This should apply from junction with Flixton Road to Stretford Roadture

284.title: Need for safe active travel infrastructure
284.issues: Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic
284.comment: Very narrow stretch of road with cars often parked on one side creating dangerous pinch point

285.title: Need for safe active travel infrastructure
285.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding

286.title: Need for enhanced public space to enable post lockdown trading
286.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Behaviour of road users users
286.solutions: Close street to cars_,_Spaces to sit and wait_,_More space to walk_,_Add temporary cycle path
286.comment: If Flixton Rd was closed between Park Rd South and the junction with Station Rd, then this could create a new public realm that local traders could use to set up temporary "night markets" with socially distanced spaces to enable them to trade as restrictions start to be lifted. This would also significantly reduce traffic cutting down Flixton Rd which could use Church Road or Moorside Rd, however both those roads need safe cycling routes adding to mitigate the extra traffic.

287.title: Filter entrance to Framingham Road - motor access to shops only
287.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Crucial cycle route (to Timperley via Wood Rd) is blighted by parking and through-motoring
287.solutions: Prevent through traffic_,_Spaces to sit and wait_,_More space to walk_,_More space to cycle_,_Manage school run motoring
287.comment: The combination of car parking, through-motoring and cycling seems too much for this section of Framingham Road, where cycling regularly feels unsafe and motoring is often impractical due to people parking or turning in the road. The highways network would support a point filter at this location, retaining motor access for the shops and businesses near the station but preventing direct motor access to the residential section of Framingham Road - residents needing to drive to their properties would be able to accomplish this via Woodbourne Road, a much safer junction on Brooklands Road which wouldn't result in cars backing up and blocking the traffic light junction as they currently do when trying to enter Framingham Road directly.

288.title: Need for safe active travel infrastructure
288.issues: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open_,_Barriers that prevent access
288.comment: Remove style which is totally ineffective anyway as there are other routes onto the meadows without barriers which would enable mopeds etc. on if they so wished. But I see a lot of families want to ride on the meadows who turn back because of the style here.

289.title: Need for safe active travel infrastructure
289.issues: Barriers that prevent access_,_Barriers/gates you have to touch or open_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
289.comment: The barriers here create congestion (making social distancing difficult) and do not prevent anyone except hindering legitimate users. open the gate is all that is needed.

290.title: Warburton Bridge
290.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Speeding_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
290.solutions: Slow down traffic_,_More space to cycle_,_Extend pavement_,_More space to walk
290.comment: Because of the amount of traffic going across this bridge, and the extremely narrow pavements, which are made worse by armco barriers, nobody likes to walk over here.  Cycling is fraught with danger as many motorists are too impatient to wait as you climb the hill on either side.  At the very least, the pavements need to be extended and given a proper surface so we can walk in safety.  For example, why are the armco barriers on the pavement, reducing space for pedestrians?  If they're to protect motorists then they should take space away from motoring.

291.title: Bridgewater Canal bridge, School Lane
291.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users
291.solutions: Prevent through traffic_,_Spaces to sit and wait_,_More space to walk_,_More space to cycle_,_Slow down traffic_,_Extend pavement
291.comment: It's another ratrun used by people to avoid the main roads, but it's also popular with people walking and cycling.  There's an entry point to the canal so there are nearly always pedestrians at this point.  I would suggest most drivers here are using the road to access Partington or Broadheath, and that they should instead be forced to use the A56 or A6144.

292.title: Davyhulme Rd/Woodhouse Rd junction
292.solutions: Close street to cars_,_Extend pavement_,_Better crossings_,_Slow down traffic_,_More space to walk_,_More space to cycle
292.comment: The hedges on this corner, from the garden centre and the nearby houses, are always overgrown, forcing you to walk near the carriageway.  You can't social distance here.  But the left turn onto Woodhouse Road is difficult to cross because cars come around it at a good 30mph.  Why not block this junction off - traffic can still turn onto Woodhouse Road a few metres further along, but they'll have to be a little bit slower to do so - which makes it safer for everyone.  Meanwhile, people walking and cycling can still use the shortcut.

293.title: Brooklands: crossing from canal to Metrolink station and Framingham Rd
293.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Safe crossing and wider pavement required asap
293.solutions: Extend pavement_,_Better crossings_,_More space to cycle_,_Slow down traffic_,_More space to walk_,_Cycle link to Framingham Rd
293.comment: A proper signalled crossing is required between the canal and Metrolink, along with wider footways especially on the station side. This scheme should also facilitate safe cycle access to Framingham Rd, without requiring people to negotiate right turns at the large traffic light junction and from Brooklands Road. Please also consider narrowing and consolidating the numerous entrances into the shopping and parking areas from Brooklands and Framingham roads.

294.title: My street
294.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
294.comment: The double yellow lines which went further up this junction have been painted out, the single yellow lines now promote parking over the tactiles.  The single yellows also encourage pavement parking making it difficult to pass safely

295.title: NA
295.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Overgrown Hedges
295.solutions: More space to walk_,_Less parking_,_Extend pavement_,_More space to cycle_,_Close street to cars
295.comment: This is a really difficult area for pedestrians with excessive parking, overgrown hedges and narrow pavements making it very difficult to navigate

296.title: My commute
296.comment: Walton Road is used as a ratrun by vehicles trying to avoid queues on the Washway Road. Closing it to through traffic would prevent this and open up this for people to cycle on as an alternative to the canal path (especially at night when the canal is unlit)

297.title: My town centre
297.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic
297.comment: If broad road could be closed to cars from northeden Rd it would make walking and cycling across the bridge much safer. It is really difficult cutting across to the middle lane in front of the town hall when cars are turning left into broad Rd. They could use irlam Rd to turn left further down.

298.title: Brooklands Road - cycleway required from Framingham to roundabout
298.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Speeding_,_Close passes
298.solutions: Extend pavement_,_More space to cycle_,_Slow down traffic_,_More space to walk_,_Add temporary cycle path
298.comment: This heavily-trafficked road needs some form of cycling provision, at least from the roundabout to Framingham Road which then offers a quieter parallel route to Brooklands station. Due to the limited space, a 2-way option on the Trafford (SW) side of the road seems most appropriate, and this could be facilitated with cones as a trial, to immediately improve the walking and cycling options and discourage drivers from speeding.

299.title: Framingham Road pocket park and filter opportunity
299.issues: Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic
299.solutions: Spaces to sit and wait_,_More space to walk_,_Slow down traffic_,_Prevent through traffic_,_Extend pavement_,_More space to cycle_,_Safe space for children to play / exercise
299.comment: Removing through-motoring from this section of Framingham Road would make cycling along its length much safer, and would also provide space for a pocket park area, enabling local residents to get fresh air and exercise in safety. Framingham Road is a much safer alternative to the narrow NW section of Brooklands Road. A continuous route from Brooklands Metrolink station to Brooklands roundabout could be created with the addition of a cycleway on the wider SE section of Brooklands Road, as detailed in https://safestreetstrafford.commonplace.is/comments/5ec7cdd1d74287f275a4da94/

300.title: Close this Rat Run!
300.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding
300.solutions: Prevent through traffic_,_Close street to cars_,_Extend pavement_,_More space to walk_,_More space to cycle
300.comment: Framingham Road is used as a ratrun by vehicles trying to avoid queues on Brooklands Road. Closing it to through traffic would prevent this and open up this for people to cycle on as an alternative to the canal path (especially at night when the canal is unlit).  This blind bend is a serious accident waiting to happen; because of the parked cars on the eastern side, southbound cars have to drive on the wrong side of the road.  This is often done at speed and with no consideration to the traffic heading north.  Please close this rat run!

301.title: Flixton road
301.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Speeding_,_Volumes of traffic
301.solutions: More space to cycle_,_Add temporary cycle path
301.comment: This road links flixton and Urmston, its heavily used hy cars travelling WAY TO FAST. There is minimal effort at providing cycling infrastructure. This road would be very well used by cyclists if the cars were made to slow down and some proper infrastructure was installed.

302.title: Crossing Dunham Road
302.issues: There is no safe crossing to link 2 public footpaths.

303.title: commute
303.issues: Speeding_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Behaviour of road users users
303.solutions: More space to cycle_,_Add temporary cycle path_,_Slow down traffic_,_More space to walk_,_Better crossings

304.title: my commute
304.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding
304.solutions: Slow down traffic_,_More space to walk_,_Add temporary cycle path_,_Extend pavement_,_More space to cycle
304.comment: The whole of Derbyshire Lane could do with a segregated cycle lane, as many people cycle here but cars drive fast and over take close making it scary whilst on the bike. Also crossing for need to favour walkers over vehicles.

305.title: Lack of a road crossing
305.issues: A safe crossing is needed to cross from Sandiway Place over time The Mount for a safe walking route to John Leigh Park

306.title: NA
306.solutions: More space to cycle_,_Slow down traffic
306.comment: Cars pull in and out here not looking out for people on bikes

307.title: My commute
307.issues: Speeding_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Behaviour of road users users
307.solutions: More space to cycle_,_Better crossings_,_Slow down traffic
307.comment: Cycle lanes stop and start randomly throughout Trafford park and have no safe crossing, it is scary to cross a dual carriageway as cars are coming off or on to a roundabout. Cycle lanes need priority across these big roads, especially with the size of lorries and some left hand drive so drivers have limited visablity.

308.title: Crossing required on Moss Vale Rd to link Higher Rd and Bradfield Rd
308.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users
308.comment: The existing informal crossing is not sufficient considering the (sometimes motorway-like) speed of traffic and the nearby railway bridge that reduces visibility. A fully signalled crossing should be installed close to Higher Road, with a build-out to increase visibility, relocating a couple of parking spaces to the gap where the existing informal crossing is.

309.title: NA
309.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding_,_Hard to cross roundabout by foot or bicyc;e
309.solutions: Slow down traffic_,_Add temporary cycle path_,_More space to walk_,_More space to cycle_,_Extend pavement_,_Better crossings
309.comment: This roundabout has just had work done on it but crossing it by bike or foot is so dangerous and takes so many stages so could easily put people off walking or cycling.

310.title: commute
310.solutions: More space to cycle_,_Add temporary cycle path_,_Slow down traffic
310.comment: This is a dual carriage way without safe well maintained segregated cycle way. It is terrifying to cycle along especially as HGVs pass or pull out of side lanes. A full segregated cycle lane with priority at side roads is needed.

311.title: Speed on road and pedenstrian crossing
311.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding
311.solutions: Slow down traffic_,_Add temporary cycle path_,_Prevent through traffic_,_Better crossings
311.comment: Cars come flying down this road and often don't stop at the pedestrian crossing. It's treacherous trying to cross with children and/or a pram. The situation has been much easier during lockdown with less traffic, but cars still regularly go well over the speed limit.

312.title: cycle lanes stops and starts
312.solutions: Add temporary cycle path_,_Better crossings_,_More space to walk_,_More space to cycle_,_Slow down traffic_,_Extend pavement
312.comment: The cycle lane her is not segregated so many vehicles drive in it and makes it feel intimidating as many large vehicles use this road. A segregated cycle lane would allow easy cycling to Trafford park for work and Trafford centre for pleasure. The pavement also stops and starts so needs improvements to encourage use.

313.title: NA
313.solutions: Add temporary cycle path_,_Slow down traffic_,_Better crossings_,_More space to cycle
313.comment: This roundabout has just had a load of work done to it to allow the addition of the tram but no cycle provision was included.

314.title: Ability to walk past or go in shops whilst maintaining social distance
314.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Barriers that prevent access_,_Barriers/gates you have to touch or open
314.solutions: Extend pavement_,_More space to walk_,_Close street to cars_,_Spaces to sit and wait
314.comment:
The pavements are far too narrow in the village to allow safe queuing outside shops. Pedestrians passing through have no option but to squeeze past those queuing at a close distance.
In addition, trying to enter shops in the village with a pram is not possible without struggling to open doors (or have someone open them for you, resulting in close contact). There are no contactless entries unless shops leave their doors open. The village is very difficult for wheelchair or pram users.

315.title: A56
315.comment: The idea of bringing a safer place for persons to either walk or cycle along the A56 is in idea a brilliant one but unpractical at present. The width of the road itself from Altrincham to Manchester in most does not make it practical to construct a dedicated cycle lane along its length unless it is at the detriment of footpaths. Making the one of two major road arteries from the south at the moment is congested not just during weekdays but also at certain times at the weekend a single lane highway would only compound this problem as a significant proportion of this traffic is from persons who do not live in this area but commute from either the M6 or M56. This not only would increase pollutants into the air but then become a major obstacle for emergency vehicles if there was an accident or similar.

316.title: Dangerous for cyclists coming up to traffic lights
316.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Safety
316.solutions: More space to cycle_,_Add temporary cycle path
316.comment: When approaching the traffic lights on Marsland Rd, the road splits into 2 lanes. It's impossible for cyclists to queue safely at the traffic lights with cars getting so close and speeding off when the lights turn green, either to cut in front of them to turn left, or to merge into the left lane from the right

317.title: Central Road Service Rd path past Library
317.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Barriers that prevent access_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Complicated junction made more difficult by an obstruction
317.solutions: More space to walk_,_More space to cycle
317.comment:
A Trio bin has been placed on the desire line of the path . The wide side of the bin has been placed across the desire line reducing the options for path users to avoid each other. Worse the person on a bicycle on avoiding the pedestrian and the obstructions may be compromised by a motor vehicle approaching from behind (the person on the bike distracted by walker and all the obstructions ahead) . The bin needs turning through 90 degrees however....
Ideally relocate this bin against the fence where the old bin used to be now it has been removed.
https://trafford.cyclestreets.net/location/97744/

318.title: Local walking route to community centre
318.comment: There are barriers here, remove the barriers to make more space and make this a temporary cycle route through to Canterbury road where the cycle routes goes under the motorway and onto Barton Road/Lostock Rd

319.title: Access to canal
319.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
319.solutions: More space to walk_,_More space to cycle_,_Extend pavement
319.comment: Only access to the canal is through an old narrow staircase. Can this be improved / repaired or converted to a ramp.

320.title: NA
320.solutions: More space to walk_,_Slow down traffic_,_Add temporary cycle path_,_Extend pavement_,_Better crossings_,_Less parking
320.comment:
Traffic comes around corner from Dunham too fast on a blind corner.

Make stretch through / edge of town centre between High Street and Woodlands Road 20 mph,

Enforce with Specs average speed cameras.

Remove Parking

Add signalised pedestrian crossing

Widen footway.

321.title: NA
321.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
321.solutions: More space to walk_,_More space to cycle
321.comment:
This road is so badly overgrown that it's now down to about 1 metre wide in places. It just needs scraping back - the trees and bushes are all gone, it's just the soil that remains. It's half a day's work to scrape back and brush clean and you have a much, much wider and safer route. It's already popular with walkers and cyclists - cleaning it would make it moreso.

Also, please fix the streetlights - it isn't an issue at this time of year but in the winter this is a dark, lonely place.

322.title: my local bus stops
322.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
322.solutions: Extend pavement_,_Spaces to sit and wait_,_Slow down traffic
322.comment:
Footway much too narrow at bus stops. Impossible to social distance.

Extend footway/narrow carriageway to 4m

Make section from A56 to John At buses and cycle only, with widened footway throughout.that length.

Make section between A56 and

323.title: Left turn filter lane
323.issues: Speeding_,_Barriers that prevent access_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic
323.solutions: Better crossings_,_Slow down traffic_,_More space to cycle_,_Extend pavement_,_Close street to cars_,_More space to walk_,_Close filter lane
323.comment:
Make traffic for M60 turn left at main stop line.

Not appropriate for such a high speed slip from the A56.

Removes crossings and danger on cycle path of being swiped off bike when there is queuing traffic that begins to move on A56, which does not look for cycles coming up on inside.

324.title: Stretford Road
324.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Main Commuting Route
324.solutions: Add temporary cycle path_,_More space to cycle
324.comment: A protected cycle lane has recently has recently been installed on Stretford Road in Trafford . At the boundary the suddenly stops . Provide temporary cycle lane from the boundary all the way to the University with a view to putting in permanent infrastructure .

325.title: Unofficial car park
325.solutions: Close street to cars_,_More space to walk
325.comment:
This area is used for parking at night, right around the cenotaph. Please barrier off properly to protect space for pedestrians. A lot of cracked flags here due parking.
Thanks

326.title: Pavement parking
326.comment: Pavements are blocked due pavement parking. Difficult for wheelchair, prams, electric scooter users as dropped curbs blocked too

327.title: Access to Bridgewater Way
327.solutions: Better crossings_,_Extend pavement_,_More space to walk
327.comment: The only access from Dane Road onto the Bridgewater Way towpath is via Danefield road. There is no footpath and a desire line has been created across the verge. There used to be steps at the pin location, but these have since been closed/forgotten about. The steps should be reinstated and/or a new ramp built.

328.title: My road
328.comment: The dual lane of washway road should be single lane on either side with cycle paths / extended pavements using up the space created. This will eventually lead to reduced traffic along this exceptionally busy corridor (as drivers find alternative routes). In addition hgvs should be required to use carrington spur to reduce pollution/noise/vibrations in a dense residential area.

329.title: Commuting Route
329.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
329.solutions: More space to cycle_,_Slow down traffic
329.comment:
Existing basic cycle infrastructure here is faded and worn. Often ignored by queuing traffic during rush hour, who pull to the left to allow cars to illegally filter on the right rather than wait. This causes very limited space for cycles and 'left hooks' from motorists. There's also lots of mobile phone use while waiting in queues, often while pulling left!
There is no way to avoid this intersection and join the Canal at Brooklands when coming from the top end of Firs Road.

330.title: My local area
330.solutions: More space to cycle_,_Add temporary cycle path
330.comment: We need a safe alternative to make short distance journeys. There are large queues of traffic in both directions throughout the day. Mostly one person per car.  We need to design that reduces volume of traffic so that people who need to drive can do so more easily. Do this by making it safer for those who don’t t need to drive to take a safe and healthy option.

331.title: NA
331.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Behaviour of road users users
331.solutions: Add temporary cycle path_,_More space to cycle_,_Slow down traffic
331.comment: Traffic speeds towards double roundabout, which is also intimidating for new/inexperienced cyclists. Cars often park alongside bikes waiting at the roundabout, placing them at risk.

332.title: My street
332.solutions: More space to cycle_,_Slow down traffic
332.comment: Cars have always driven far too fast down this road. It has access to the park and is also well used by school children attending both Wellfield primary school and Park Road primary school. The road is used as a cut through to take traffic off A56. I fear this will get busy when the  A 56 is narrowed to accommodate cycle lanes, which I do agree with. As the road is straight it encourages cars to drive far too fast.

333.title: My Street
333.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
333.solutions: More space to walk_,_Stop pavement parking
333.comment:
It can be impossible to walk on the pavements on this side road as cars park on them. There is never enough room to push a pram through.
Please stop cars from parking on the pavements.

334.title: Local street
334.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Speeding_,_Volumes of traffic

356.title: Rat running & school parking
356.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding
356.solutions: Prevent through traffic_,_Slow down traffic_,_More space to walk_,_Enforce current parking restrictions
356.comment: Marlborough/Montague Road is primarily a narrow residential crescent, made dangerous by speeding traffic rat-running to avoid the l/h only turn at the top of Hope Road or to avoid the lights at the top of Wardle Road. In normal times, cars can be regularly found parked on yellow lines, or on the pavements, especially at school pick up and drop off, making for an unsafe and hazardous environment. The school playground is also used as a church "car park",  with cars exiting for speed to Marlborough via the playground gates instead of through the main car park entrance. Current road restrictions are rarely policed.

383.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

384.title: Changing Hillingdon Road - Stretford, into a quiet space for residents.
384.issues: Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Rat run and through road to beat the Traffic Lights on Kings Road/Edge Lane
384.solutions: Spaces to sit and wait_,_Prevent through traffic
384.comment:
We have quickly surveyed some (not all) residents along the road and those that have commented are overwhelmingly in favour for our road to be safer and quieter place for families to sit, play chat and dwell in pleasanter surroundings.

We would like to test two options:
Option 1 - Temporary filter Hillingdon Road at the Edge Lane junction - i.e. closed to vehicular access.

Option 2 - Make Hillingdon Road one way from Edge lane to Faulkner Road.

We would also wish to create some chicanes by adding parklets and benches to alter the layout of the road from a straight road to a curvy one and a place where people can sit and talk whilst kids play.

387.comment: This side road is well used by pupils going to Urmston Juniors, English Martyrs, the nurseries and Urmston grammar. It is a link from Eden Square to the alleyway that runs behind Roseneath rd to all of these. Excessive parking, including on the pavement makes this unsafe. Remove parking, make it access only for residents to access the rear of their properties and this will create a safe route for children to walk, scoot or cycle to school.

It is a direct route to and from Eden Square and even though there is a zebra at the junction with Roseneath Road, hardly any cars stop there and that is out of the way for anybody coming out of Denstone Road - a route to Old Crofts bank etc.  For older people  even a short detour is tiring.  Maybe build out the pavement here to give better visibility or even better remove on street parking

Also vehicles leaving M60 for A6144 use BOTH lanes to turn right to gain a car length advantage by “undertaking” on the inside lane at speed. Very dangerous.

417.title: Travelling straight on A6144 into Sale, cars turning left onto Worthington Road
417.solutions: Slow down traffic_,_More space to cycle_,_Better crossings
417.comment: When travelling straight into Sale Moor on bicycle, cars turning left onto Worthington Riad often speed and cut up cyclist to access Worthington Road  as they turn left. Additionally cars turning right out of Worthington Road frequently encroach into the space required by cyclists to proceed, thus resulting in cyclist having to move into road not knowing what traffic is coming behind them.

418.title: Marshland Road to Sale Moor
418.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users
418.solutions: More space to cycle_,_Close street to cars_,_Slow down traffic_,_Prevent through traffic
418.comment: When cycling from Marsland Road and into Sale Moor, one has to position oneself dangerously as cars follow from behind and travel from Northern Moor (usually at speed) and then either move left to access Northenden Road or right to access Sale Moor. It is difficult and dangerous for cyclists to safely negotiate the splits in the traffic if travelling through Sale Moor.

419.title: Old Hall Road
419.comment: Traffic leaving Sale Moor rapidly speeds up as approaching M60 and to try and “catch the lights” at Dane Road. Abused by cars, motorcycles and hgv’s. Ad hoc/occasional or permanent speed cameras would helps. At rush hours when traffic slows, the number of mobile telephone users driving is appalling and extremely dangerous.

420.title: Rifle Road access to Metrolink station.
420.comment: For pedestrians and cyclists travelling from Sale Moor, they will have  negotiated two poor/dangerous crossings as vehicles access the m60 clockwise and leave the M60 anti clockwise. It is not uncommon for vehicles to speed/accelerate into Rifle Road just at the point that cyclists may have remounted and pedestrians are crossing Rifle Road to access the Metrolink station.

421.title: Barrier stops double buggies or bucket bikes getting access from Stretford to Sale Water park
421.wantperm: Would need to see the evidence
421.issues: Barriers that prevent access_,_Barriers/gates you have to touch or open
421.comment: There are a number of steel barriers for cycle paths that make it hard for double buggies/bucket bikes to pass freely.  Would strongly encourage a review of these.

422.title: Drop curbs along the A56
422.comment: Improve this whole stretch of the A56 northbound to improve path for pedestrians and cyclists.  MANY curbs are not dropped, path disappears at the recycling centre cutting off cycle routes safely from the rest of Stretford.

423.title: Pedestrian Crossing
423.issues: Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic
423.comment: There is little time to safely cross the road. Cars often ignore the red light delay people crossing. The lights need to go red quicker and stay on red for a further 10 seconds to enable people to cross safely. The pavement outside the shops is very narrow too.

424.title: My street
424.comment:
Cars travel well over posted 30 mph limit. Which considering Henrietta Street passes a large park and is in a residential neighborhood seems like an excessive speed limit. Propose 20 mph limit and traffic calming measures.

Since cars park either side and it is not possible for 2 cars to pass each other possible solution would be narrowing road in places and adding planters

425.title: Local area
425.issues: Speeding_,_Volumes of traffic_,_No safe road crossings
425.solutions: Slow down traffic_,_More space to walk_,_Better crossings
425.comment: Kings road from at least Seymour Grove to Upper Chorlton road does not have ONE single pedestrian crossing. I walk daily (pre and during covid) and cross this road with a pram or on bicycle and it is extremely dangerous. Parked cars make it difficult to see oncoming traffic and the lack of crossing points makes it dangerous for anyone attempting to cross the road.

426.title: Dangerous road for cycling
426.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users
426.solutions: Add temporary cycle path_,_More space to cycle_,_Slow down traffic_,_Extend pavement
426.comment: There are two lanes for cars Westbound here, until one filters towards Sale. This is unnecessary. One lane could be closed and used for cycling and an extended pavement.

427.title: Remove anti-cycling barriers
427.issues: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open_,_Barriers that prevent access

428.title: Anti-cycle barriers
428.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Barriers that prevent access
428.comment: There are two anti-cycling barriers on the bridge over the brook. It's a pinchpoint for walkers and cyclists, which makes social distancing difficult. The barriers should be removed.

429.title: No cycling signs
429.comment: Remove the 'No Cycling' signs on all access points to this section of Baguley Lane.

430.title: Remove barriers
430.issues: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open

431.title: Barriers on Birch Road
431.issues: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open_,_Barriers that prevent access
431.solutions: More space to cycle_,_More space to walk
431.comment:
These barriers (were they erected with planning permission?) force people walking and riding to use a narrow gap at the side. This makes social distancing a problem. And if you're elderly or infirm and struggle to lift your bicycle across the barrier, it might prevent you making your journey full stop.

I understand anti-social behaviour by people driving on the fields is why these barriers exist, but they should not exclude legitimate, legal users of Carrington Moss.

432.title: My street
432.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Volumes of traffic
432.solutions: More space to walk_,_Prevent through traffic
432.comment: Ashfield Road is a narrow, single lane two-way connection that is a busy rat run between Manor Road & Hale Road. Its narrow pavements don’t allow pedestrians to pass at safe distance. Stopping through traffic would reduce traffic flow, allowing walkers to use the road to keep safe distancing and encouraging safe cycling.

433.title: Dark Lane
433.issues: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open
433.solutions: More space to walk_,_More space to cycle
433.comment: Dark Lane is a hugely overgrown road and a public right of way, but it's almost unusable now.  If it were cleared it would be a much nicer way of getting from Whitehouse Lane to Birch Road, free of traffic.  Sinderland Lane is pretty much impossible to walk along.

434.title: Barriers on Common Lane
434.comment: A gate has been built at the end of this public right of way, removing access to Carrington Moss for everyone.  This has been done to keep motorcycles off the moss, but why should everyone suffer for the actions of a minority?  It needs to be removed.  It's the police who should deal with antisocial behaviour - law-abiding folk need not be punished.

435.title: My local High street
435.issues: Barriers that prevent access_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
435.solutions: Better crossings_,_Add temporary cycle path_,_More space to cycle
435.comment: The crossing has a dog leg island in the middle controlled by two separate beg buttons. It makes it very hard and slow to cross from the west of the A56 to the east (to access the canal bridle way which is the only safe route to Sale centre). It’s impossible to maintain 2m distance on the island as well.

436.title: My street
436.solutions: Add temporary cycle path_,_Slow down traffic
436.comment: This corner is incredibly dangerous. There have been a number of accidents due to cars speeding around the corner and losing control. It is also a major crossing point for children for the park and 2 primary schools and a cycle route for older children to aom school.. there should be a 20 mile an hour limit along the whole of glebelands Road, traffic calming measures on this corner.

437.title: My local street
437.issues: Speeding_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
437.solutions: More space to walk_,_More space to cycle_,_Extend pavement_,_Slow down traffic
437.comment: Cars use Barkers Lane as a cut through and regularly speed. The road is the access to a primary school and a nursery so there are lots of kids around making this dangerous. The footpaths are narrow and you have to walk in the road to keep 2m apart, which is dangerous given the speeding traffic. Speed limit should be reduced to 20mph.

438.title: My local street
438.comment: its the condition of the road surface on Oxford Rd that's the real issue that needs to be fixed. Pot holes are the biggest and deepest I've seen in the area so makes cycling dangerous as well as cars swaying to avoid them. Its a very well used tgmhrough road that needs urgent tlc.

439.title: strip of land between Barton Rd and Iona Way
439.solutions: More space to walk_,_More space to cycle
439.comment:
This strip of green land, under which I presume is the Thirlmere Aqueduct, is a perfect place for people to exercise and a good shortcut for cycling - but it's blocked off at either end.

There's no reason why people can't walk here, or cycle (given a decent surface), so why not remove the gates and allow people to use it?

440.title: Rivers Lane path
440.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
440.solutions: More space to cycle_,_More space to walk
440.comment: Please send a team down to remove the overgrowth and extend the pavement - it's impossible to stay distant from other users here.  And there's tonnes of space to make this path wider.  It'd also be great if you could add more access points, as that might make vulnerable users feel safer.

441.title: Washway Road
441.comment: The A56 is dangerous to cycle on and difficult to cross. It’s the main obstacle to people being able to use their bikes for short trips. Yet there are acres of tarmac. There’s plenty of space to add segregated cycle lanes without removing lanes for cars. Narrower lanes might even make drivers obey the speed limit too.

442.title: Crossing needed on Barrington Road
442.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding_,_A pedestrian crossing needed .
442.comment:
Barrington Road is primarily a residential road and used by children en route to school but there is no safe crossing .
Residents of the retirement flats find it difficult to cross over to the bus stops.

443.title: Market area
443.issues: It’s time that the whole market area is closed to traffic (except for deliveries at certain times )
443.comment: We’ve lost a couple of trees in this area already due to cars reversing into them.

444.title: Moss Vale Road Urmston
444.comment: Publicly maintained hedges on Moss Vale Road Urmston are so overgrown that they take up all the pavement. Which makes pedestrians walk in the road and the cyclists and motorists have to swerve to avoid. Dangerous

445.title: Wash way road
445.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Speeding
445.solutions: More space to cycle_,_Slow down traffic_,_Add temporary cycle path_,_Better crossings
445.comment: Love this idea. Well done Trafford. I will definitely use my bike if cycle lane is installed on wash way road.

446.title: Roads around Navigation School
446.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Idling traffic
446.solutions: Slow down traffic_,_Better crossings_,_Plant more street trees

447.title: The corner outside Allen's Chicken
447.comment: There are lots of cars that park literally on and across the pavement. Pedestrians can be forced to walk in the road. Add 2m distancing and it becomes awkward.

448.title: My street
448.solutions: Prevent through traffic_,_Slow down traffic_,_Close street to cars
448.comment: There is also a private school on this road before a blind bend and the speed at which cars drive down is terrible. It's only a matter of time before someone gets hurt.

449.title: My street
449.solutions: Close street to cars_,_Prevent through traffic

450.title: NA
450.solutions: Close street to cars_,_Prevent through traffic_,_Slow down traffic_,_Less parking_,_More space to cycle
450.comment:
Many children live on this road and it would be lovely if cars didnt use it as a cut through. The children have been able to cycle safely up and down the street during this eased lockdown.

Some people have 6 cars on their driveway and road its unnecessary. Let keep the air pollution free for our children and grandchildren.

451.title: Crossing the road
451.issues: Need to look across a wide area before crossing
451.solutions: Slow down traffic_,_Prevent through traffic_,_Better crossings
451.comment: I've always disliked crossing the road here with the kids. You have to look all the way around, almost 360 degrees, before deciding to cross.

452.title: HAYLING ROAD
452.issues: Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic
452.solutions: More space to cycle_,_More space to walk_,_Prevent through traffic_,_Slow down traffic
452.comment:
Too many people parking on pavements.
Households with far too may cars parked on the street.

Speed at which people drive down the road is scary especially when alot of young children live here.

I would like this street to have speed bumps or better still close one end off.
Parking restrictions would also be welcome.

453.title: Marslsnd rd
453.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
453.comment: The trees in the middle of the footpath make it hard to walk here. I'm not suggesting we get rid of the trees but rather improve the pavement area.

454.title: Woodlands parkway
454.comment: You have to watch all the lights and time your crossing. A green man would be good. A busy crossing place at school time.

455.title: My town centre
455.issues: Volumes of traffic_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
455.solutions: Better crossings_,_Extend pavement_,_Prevent through traffic_,_More space to walk_,_More space to cycle
455.comment: The area between Costa, M&S, Bean and Brush, Bianco's & Tesco is just awful to walk around. It's a valid part of the town centre and has high footfall. Cars are coming from all directions and often pause to drop or collect passengers. Better crossings and wider footpaths would be great.

456.title: NA
456.issues: It would be good to have a designated cycle route that encompasses the many nature trails and walks there are in Partington so that families with small children can ride together safely. It would encourage more people to get active and explore the local area rather than jumping in the car to visit other places.

457.title: Bike path
457.comment: Hitting tree roots here on my bike gave me whiplash!

458.title: My high street
458.wantperm: Would need to see the evidence
458.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
458.comment:
A larger pavement to support the burgeoning cafe culture here would be an excellent way to benefit the businesses we have relied on through the pandemic but also to facilitate safer outdoor socialising once restrictions are lifted a bit more.
Cars could be routed down Broad rd and Woodlands back onto Northenden road.

459.title: Tow path surface - part surface over some of the cobbled area to support cycling.
459.issues: Surface of the route for cycling

460.title: Footway regularly blocked with parked cars
460.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
460.solutions: Bollards to block vehicles mounting the footway
460.comment: The section of footway between the junction and the parade is regularly blocked with parked cars, meaning 2m distance can't be maintained. Bollards should be added to stop vehicles mounting the footway.

461.title: Footway regularly blocked with parked cars
461.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Behaviour of road users users
461.solutions: Bollards to block vehicles mounting the footway
461.comment: The section of footway outside the shops is regularly blocked with parked cars, meaning 2m distance can't be maintained. Bollards should be added to stop vehicles mounting the footway.

462.title: Accessible Green Space
462.issues: Barriers that prevent access_,_Small missing link to trans pennine trail
462.solutions: More space to cycle_,_More space to walk_,_Spaces to sit and wait_,_Add temporary cycle path_,_Increase accessibility for wheelchair users
462.comment:
By laying temporary track down from Turn Moss car park to Hawthorne Road it completes a small but vital missing link to enable cyclist and walker to enjoy the TPT.

Use if temp track was laid similar to what is uses at festivals and construction sites would create a path for 1000s of people to use and provide access for disabled people and wheel chair users.

463.title: Sale Moor Centre
463.issues: Barriers/gates you have to touch or open
463.comment: I often see people leaving the pub and vaulting the central barrier to cross the road. That's not safe and if people want to go that way, why not just let them and slow the traffic down.

464.title: Walking route to amenities
464.comment: This is a key walking route to a GP surgery, clinic and Lime Tree school. This winter the footpath was under water for 3 months thus cutting off the route.

465.title: The Lane
465.comment: I love the lane and use it whenever I can. It would be nice if better management of the green space could increase its potential to support nature. It would be nice if the community garden at the Cranston drive end could be given some funding and support to put in more variety of plants.

466.title: Warburton toll bridge
466.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Stopping to pay 12p and hand it to a person who is not the safe distance away.
466.solutions: More space to cycle_,_Get rid of the toll booth permanently.
466.comment: The booth is tiny and 2 people working can't safe distance from each other or the public.

467.title: NA
467.solutions: Slow down traffic_,_More space to cycle_,_Extend pavement
467.comment: Great Stone Road approaching Talbot Road from the Quadrant gradually becomes wider before the junction, encouraging drivers to act as if there are 2 lanes. Aside from risk of traffic accidents, a lack of safe crossing for pedestrians between Gorse Ave and cricket ground means it's a gauntlet for cyclists and those on foot. Suggest dedicated cycle lane and additional lights for safe crossing

468.title: Prevent rat running, to reduce speeds and make roads safer
468.issues: Speeding_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Behaviour of road users users
468.comment:
It's currently possible to drive through the whole of the Gorse Hill estate from Thomas Street to Partridge Street, along Gorse Street, Burleigh Road, Avondale Road and Railway Road. This encourages rat running and speeding along this route when the traffic is busy on the A56.

This makes the roads dangerous and stops children from playing on them. The route also passes a primary school and a nursery.

A modal filter should be added to Burleigh Road to prevent through traffic, while allowing walking and cycling.

469.title: Delahays Road
469.comment: The current speed limit on Delahays Road is 30 mph. However most road users clearly ignore this. I would wish for consideration to installing a flashing speed display to remind people of the current speed limit - like the one on Grove Lane - or indeed a speed camera - that will help finance essential services!!

470.title: Swan with 2 Nicks bridge
470.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Barriers/gates you have to touch or open
470.solutions: More space to walk_,_More space to cycle
470.comment:
This bridge is ridiculous. There's so much pedestrian and cyclist traffic across it on a nice day that queues develop on either side. It can be difficult to see people waiting too. The bridge is so narrow that some people who have poor balance are forced to touch the structure, which potentially increases the chances of transmitting Covid 19.

It should be replaced with a much wider structure that can accommodate people walking and cycling, and also those riding horses.

471.title: New cycle route from Urmston to Ashton-upon-Mersey
471.comment: This is a fantastic route now that the muddy surface has been upgraded and the barriers removed, but it's beginning to show potholes and ruts on the gravel sections, particularly by the golf course where there are dozens of deep potholes.  So please upgrade it to a smooth surface, like the Roe Green Loopline in Salford.

472.title: Improve access to the path next to Kellogg's at the end of Moss Road
472.issues: Improve access_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
472.solutions: More space to cycle_,_More space to walk
472.comment:
Access to the path next to Kellogg's at the end of Moss Road is currently quite difficult, due to a tight turn and overgrown vegetation. With it being a blind bend, it makes the corner accident prone and 2m distance can't be maintained.

The end of Moss Road with the blocks on the road is quite unwelcoming also, which will put people off using this route, which is a key walking and cycling route to Trafford Park from Stretford. This should be tidied up.

473.title: Tunnel under the M60
473.comment: This is a fantastic facility but it's very poorly signed.  Those unfamiliar with the area, or new to walking and cycling, might now know it exists.  Please consider some signage on Lostock and Barton Roads directing people to this tunnel.  This could even be in the form of a small sign at the roundabout, saying "cyclists, do you know there's an underpass just over there>>>"

474.title: Superb crossing
474.comment: This is an absolutely superb facility enabling cyclists to safely continue from Talbot Road to Stretford Road.  My only minor gripe is that some motorists run the red light, so you have to be alert to this.  Is there some way the red light could be better enforced?

475.title: Closing Dorset At entrance at Chester Road
475.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic
475.comment: Restricting car access to Dorset St at Chester Road will improve safety for pedestrians accessing Stretford Public Hall and also those living on Dorset St itself, where this is used as a cut through during Rush Hour

476.title: Disabled parking
476.solutions: People using disabled space to park.
476.comment: People are always parking illegal in disabled space daily and nothing is done about it.  Not everyone can walk to the shop.  Time for a clamp down

477.title: Commercial area
477.issues: Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic
477.solutions: Close street to cars_,_Extend pavement_,_Spaces to sit and wait_,_More space to cycle_,_More space to walk_,_Slow down traffic
477.comment:
Speeding is a major issue on Chester road. With the mall redevelopping, including new bars and restaurants, this section of the road is currently inadequate. By extending the pavement, reducing the number of traffic lanes and using that space for cycling and walking, not only would it be safer but also comercially more viable.

Also, as one of the main reasons cars speed on this section is because it is a long straight line, installing a system such as chicanes would help reduce the speed.

478.title: Local bus.
478.comment: There are no bus for shift workers.  Non for a 5am start. Only one bus per hour.  Not everyone can ride a bike and we are too far to walk anywhere.  Your just interested in getting cars off the road.  Not fair.  Especially when they have children to get home to.

479.title: The crossing
479.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Speeding_,_Volumes of traffic
479.comment: The crossing near new moon is unnecessary and dangerous. Cars ignore it so pedestrians particularly children have started crossing And the car in the second lane hasn’t seen them and just drives through. We have seen several near misses.

480.title: Pedestrians crossing park rd at the junction with washway rd
480.issues: Unsafe for predestines to cross the rd here

481.title: Pedestrian access to Leisure centre
481.comment: Crossing the road in front of the leisure centre (especially with small children) is really difficult. There is an endless stream of traffic from Northernden Road, and if there is a break, then cars come from the car parks and wharf road. Crossing needed.

482.title: Need safe area to run where dont get bullied by cyclist , cars or dogs off leads chasing you, as lone female runner feels very unsafe been out any time , please make it easier for us all to get around safely and without harassment
482.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
482.solutions: Extend pavement_,_Prevent through traffic_,_More space to walk

483.title: NA
483.solutions: More space to cycle_,_Prevent through traffic_,_Slow down traffic
483.comment: The cycle lane sort of evaporates at the end of Talbot Rd to emerge again on Chester Road. This allows drivers to speed straight down Chester Road and clip cyclists as they go.

484.title: The lane behind my house
484.comment: This country lane is part of the transpennine trail now that access via Dairyhouse Farm has been closed off, but the traffic related to Asda and Waitrose and workers on the industrial estate makes it too dangerous to cycle down, and sometimes even a bit precarious to walk down, particularly at certain times of day, with cars and bikes often travelling at high speed with it being a national speed limit road and really not much wider than a single track lane at parts. It would be great to see traffic on this road minimised (or at least slowed down) to enable safer access to the pedestrian part of the transpennine trail at the other end of Dairyhouse Lane.

485.title: My local streets
485.issues: Speeding_,_It is difficult to cross this round about as there are no ‘half way’ traffic islands which allow you to walk into the centre and have a better view of the traffic to make it safer to cross. There are ‘half way’ traffic islands at the round about near Waitrose/bramley farm. The speed to cars is also too fast, traffic islands might slow the traffic down.

486.title: Ashton-on-Mersey Village
486.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Obstructions on the pavements
486.solutions: More space to walk_,_Less parking_,_Remove plant troughs and other temporary street furniture provided for Village in Bloom_,_Better crossings_,_Close street to cars
486.comment:
I currently find it difficult to comply with social distancing while negotiating the cluttered pavements, which makes me reluctant to shop in the Village.
Parked cars and two-way traffic have always made crossing the road hazardous.
I feel this would be a good opportunity to consider making the Village either a pedestrian zone, except for resident access, or at least making traffic flow one-way with limited parking on one side of the road, for deliveries and blue badge holders only.

487.title: NA
487.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Drivers parking on pavement
487.solutions: Less parking_,_Add temporary cycle path_,_Extend pavement
487.comment: All along both sides of the street In this area drivers use the wide pavement to park. They should be fined. Pavements are for pedestrians, it’s extremely dangerous to drive on pavements. Street furniture like planters should be employed, or ideally a permanent, fully segregated cycle way erected.

488.title: NA
488.comment: Rat run. Parking on both sides of the street turns it into a single lane route, which encourages speeding. Cars parked on pavements limits footpath space. Close it to through traffic or put up speed humps before someone is killed.

489.title: Pedestrian lights can take 5 minutes to cross the road very small central wait area.
489.issues: Very slow to cross the main road safely

491.title: My kids route to school
491.issues: Inadequate, unsafe and confusing cycle path
491.comment: My kids would live to cycle to school at Sale Grammar but it is too dangerous.  What cycle path is there already is badly faded. Part of the cycle path goes on the pavement and it’s confusing where it goes. A proper cycle path would also help reduce traffic going towards the school from Sale and the amount of kids that have to catch the bus from West Sale to school

493.title: NA
493.comment: Hundreds of school children cross at this section daily and cars go so fast down this road. A proper crossing (lights/zebra) is needed here.

494.title: my local neighbourhood
494.issues: Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Parking of vehicles on pavements
494.solutions: Slow down traffic_,_More space to walk_,_Less parking_,_Extend pavement_,_More space to cycle
494.comment:
I would like to see a 10mph speed limit in the neighbourhood bounded by Ashton Ln,- Moss Ln,- Harboro Rd and Carrington Lane to discourage vehicle drivers from cutting through at speed and allowing roads to be more safely used by pedestrians, children and cyclists.
Also, preventing vehicles being parked on pavements to allow adequate space for pedestrians esp for pram, mobility scooter and wheelchair users. Currently many people are forced to use the roadway, instead of the pavements. If vehicles cannot be parked off-road, it might be beneficial to introduce a one-way flow on narrower roads, or road narrowing points around obstacles, such as large trees.

495.title: My street
495.solutions: Better crossings_,_More space to cycle_,_Slow down traffic_,_Extend pavement
495.comment: Long wide road speeding road users. More cycle walking priority and yes required with clear parking bays delineated.

496.title: unsafe crossing for pedestrians
496.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
496.comment: This junction is very difficult for pedestrians to cross safely as traffic can come from 4 different directions and comes at speed, unseen, round the bend on Ashton Lane

497.title: Faulkner Road
497.wantperm: Would need to see the evidence
497.comment: Concerned suggestion to make Hillingdon Road one way would move the rat run and described problems to Faulkner Road. This would need to be included in any one system and residents on Faulkner, Truro and Tresco consulted

498.title: Chip shop queue takes up pavement
498.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others

499.title: traffic island creating 'pinch point'
499.comment: There is a traffic island here where it is not possible for a bike and car to pass in safety. Yet some drivers refuse to slow down and let the bike go through.

500.title: overtaking hazard
500.solutions: Slow down traffic_,_Add temporary cycle path_,_More space to walk
500.comment: The section of Ashton Lane (from Ashlands to Barkers Lane) is relatively narrow and has several corners which reduce the sight-lines needed by drivers to safely overtake cyclists. Consequently most drivers simply pass without the 1.5m gap and create a dangerous close pass.  (I had a bus pass me here with literally a few inches clearance). The junctions with Queens Road and Plant Close add to the hazards. Coupled to this, the pavement is narrow and has a huge tree across it often forcing pedestrians onto the road.  (I normally try to avoid this section altogether)

501.title: Unsafe crossing for pedestrians at Buck Lane - Carrington Lane
501.issues: Inadequate field of view for pedestrians
501.solutions: Better crossings_,_Extend pavement_,_Slow down traffic_,_Require hedges to be cut back to property boundary and maintained
501.comment: This is a wide road junction on a busy main road. There is no designated crossing for pedestrians or mid-point refuge. Due to overgrown hedges and road geometry, it is difficult to see traffic coming out off Buck Lane whilst watching for fast turning traffic from Carrington Lane. A designated crossing point with a central refuge would help.

502.title: my commute
502.comment: Cars often speed down this road

503.title: firsway speeding
503.comment: There are numerous traffic islands creating 'pinch points' for each lane of traffic. Drivers speed to beat you to get through, often misjudging the manoeuvre and causing danger. The temptation to speed here is all too great for drivers and speeds should be reduced

504.title: NA
504.issues: Take wall down, make it cycle/pedestrian access. It would reduce the traffic of people and bikes down the very narrow alleyway between St Hildas and St John Vianney.
504.solutions: More space to cycle_,_More space to walk
504.comment: Making this accessible by foot or bike would make moving between areas of Chorlton and Firewood safer as you don't have to go down the very narrow alleyway that you can not achieve social distance in and is very dark at night.

505.title: Renton Road and Gorse Avenue, plus many other roads on the estate
505.wantperm: Would need to see the evidence
505.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_pavement parking
505.comment: There are many cars parked on the pavement along the length of Renton Road and Gorse Avenue (and also many of the side streets on this estate).  This reduces the width of the pavement making it hard to maintain social distancing.  I think that people park in this way because the narrowness of the road means that if cars park on both sides then there is very limited room for other vehicles to pass.  As it is, it can be intimidating for cyclists when they encounter a car on this road - yet this is a signposted cycle route (and potentially a very useful one).  Most if not all of the houses long these roads have off road parking.  I suggest restricting parking along this road to one side of the road.

506.title: Marsland Road Crossing
506.comment: Upgrade this crossing to a Zebra or a Pelican crossing

507.title: Pedestrian crossing across Chorlton Road
507.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
507.comment: Pedestrians have to wait a long time to cross this busy road because the crossing is not very responsive to pressing the button.  There is very little space to wait and maintain social distancing because of various barriers and the narrow width of the pavement.  This is an important pedestrian rouge between residents living on/off Ayres Road and the green space/park opposite on the other side of Chorlton Road

508.title: NA
508.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Barriers that prevent access
508.comment: As social distancing measures are relaxed and people start travelling to work, any work to create more walking space should be made permanent to improve the flow of passengers leaving the Metrolink station.

510.title: Unsafe junction for cyclists
510.comment: This junction is extremely unsafe on a bike heading north from Altrincham, especially if you are then turning right down Hazel Rd into the residential areas.  Cars from behind frequently ignore turning signals and overtake, while cars in the other direction frequently cross the white lines to try to form two queues going south.  Needs much better junction design, or maybe make a cycling contraflow on Grosvenor Road.

The barriers have recently been put there when a cycle route was opened up but why so complicated and the barriers have sharp rather than rounded corners.

Visibility is poor on Glebelands rd with limited passing spaces there should be a 20mph speed limit.
There road is also used by a lot of HGV's which are dangerous on this narrow road. there should be a weight limit to HGV's.

519.solutions: Add temporary cycle path_,_Slow down traffic_,_Better crossings_,_More space to cycle_,_More space to walk
519.comment:
This junction is incredibly dangerous for people on bikes and on foot.
There is only a pedestrian crossing on one side (from Majestic wine to the other side of the A56) I have regularly watched people struggle to cross at the end of Glebelands road and there is no pedestrian route to Crossford Bridge playing fields.

With regards to cycling, There is no safe way to turn right into Glebelands rd when coming along the A56 from Stretford.

520.title: Route to school
520.comment: Persistent speeding of traffic down this road.

521.title: Manor Road ratrun
521.issues: Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic
521.comment: Manor Road is a ratrun used by motorists to avoid the Barton Road junction.  That's why it has speed bumps along it, while Lyndhurst Road does not (because the latter is blocked off).  Through-traffic needs to be banned up this road.  That would also make 7-ways roundabout safer.

522.title: Blocked filter
522.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Antisocial parking
522.comment: This is a really handy traffic filter but there are no double yellows on the south side, so it's regularly blocked by parked vehicles.  Please ban parking against this filter so we can use it.

523.title: Access to hospital by bicycle
523.issues: There is no easy access to my workplace from this quiet road

524.title: Ashley Road, too many cars
524.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Behaviour of road users users_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding
524.solutions: Prevent through traffic_,_Extend pavement_,_Better crossings_,_Add temporary cycle path_,_Slow down traffic_,_Less parking_,_Close street to cars_,_More space to walk_,_More space to cycle
524.comment:
Ashley Road is chaotic, rammed with motorists making unnecessary journeys. It's regularly blocked by people trying to fit huge 4x4's into little parking spaces. People park on the wrong side of the street and therefore can't see properly when pulling back out. The pavements are littered with A-frame signs and other obstacles.

It's a horrid road to walk and cycle on. It doesn't really go anywhere either - most motoring here is people driving to the local shops. Few people actually head south into Cheshire - the main road for that is Hale Road. Ashley Road should be closed to through-traffic, the parking spaces should be replaced with cycle lanes, and the local residents should consider walking and cycling, rather than driving in huge Range Rovers.

525.title: Poor road layout
525.issues: Not able to maintain 2m distance from others_,_Volumes of traffic_,_Speeding_,_Behaviour of road users users
525.solutions: Slow down traffic_,_Add temporary cycle path_,_More space to cycle_,_Better crossings
525.comment: Cars parked on the pavement mean that people exiting this junction onto Stretford road cannot adequately see oncomming traffic. They pull out Infront of cars and bikes regularly,

526.title: Illegal parking
526.issues: Behaviour of road users users_,_Not able to maintain 2m distance from others
526.solutions: Extend pavement_,_More space to walk_,_More space to cycle
526.comment:
There are double white lines to the centre of this road. That makes parking here illegal. But motorists regularly park on the west side of the road, often on the pavement too, and nothing is done about it.

It's bad enough that they're on the pavement, but given that parking opposite a solid white line is completely illegal, action needs to be taken here.

West bound.
This has been here for years but everyday there are cars parked in it.
The surface is degraded in parts.
The crossings at side roads need cycle priority and fix the lowered kerbs at these junctions.
The west exit onto the road needs rethinking as it needs a physical protection from cars coming from behind.

535.comment: An easy and cheap win here would be to signpost the quiet route from Altrincham to Timperley via Urban Road, Welman Way and across the golf course.
